p: The current Cuban State Plant Protection System (Sistema Estatal de Protecci√≥n de Plantas, SEPP) organizational structure is characterized by its multi-institutional, multisectoral, and decentralized nature ( Fig 1). This structure allows the system to have a strong and dynamic presence across the country, establishing close collaboration with the agricultural producers, who actively cooperate and support early detection, survey, management and eradication of pests.
